intro: Gymnolomia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves that are divided into three lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by berries that turn red when mature. Gymnolomia triloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
